attributes.action: Fit breathelisers on every car manufactured so the engine won't start if present
attributes.background: I am a coach driver for national express and every time I want the engine to start I have to do a breath test, should ANY amount of alcohol be found the engine won't start. This will reduce drink driving. We should have a zero tolerance against drink driving.

attributes.action: Restrict the speed of cyclists on mixed pedestrian/cyclist paths to 4 mph.
attributes.background: It is becoming very common for local authorities to improve provision for cyclists, at the expense of pedestrians, by making footpaths multi use. By the simple expedient of painting a bicycle on the footpath pedestrians lose the exclusive use of the footpath.
attributes.additional_details:
The figures for death and serious injury to pedestrians involved in accidents with cyclists is very low. But there is a perception of danger especially from inconsiderate riders.
If cyclists were restricted, to 4 mph as are class 2 mobility scooters, this would reduce the perceived threat from cyclists. This would create a compromise in mixing pedestrians with cyclists. This accepts the inevitable use by cyclists of the footpath and protects pedestrians as vulnerable road users.

attributes.action: Remove exemptions for child seats in coaches and large minibuses
attributes.background:
Children are protected (with few exceptions) from travelling unrestrained in vehicles such as cars, vans and small minibuses.

There is no such requirement for large minibuses or coaches. The law only applies to those over the age of 14.

Children under the age of 14 are being put at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
A baby on its carer's knee is legal. This child would be at serious risk of being killed in the event of a crash. Even a simple emergency stop risks crushing injuries between the adult and the seat in front.

Coaches and large minibuses must be held to the same legal standards as cars or taxis.

attributes.action: Cap private rents at Local Housing Allowance (LHA) levels in England
attributes.background: LHAs are not typical of private rents. Those claiming Housing Benefit still have to top up their total rent from other benefits - often an impossible task, leading to rent arrears and crippling poverty. LHAs must be brought into line with actual private rents, or rents capped at the level of LHA.

attributes.action: Investigate the fiscal soundness of every PFI contract current in the UK.
attributes.background: There is growing concern that the widespread use of PFI by successive Governments may have created a disproportionate financial stress on public services to the detriment of all.  A thorough investigation is therefore warranted.
attributes.additional_details: n/a

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Ban personal and commercial drone flights over residential properties
attributes.background: ​Following the recent approval from The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) granted to Amazon to test its aerial vehicles without several of the flying restrictions rules, we the undersigned seek to ban all drone flights at any height over residential properties and privately owned land.
attributes.additional_details: With the usage of drones by hobbyists, individuals and organisations on the increase we are concerned that privacy will be compromised, and catching any offenders will be near impossible. The risk of harm through drone faults will increase. Drones will be used by criminals to spy and transport illegal items. Noise pollution will increase and it will no doubt cause many homeowners to feel uncomfortable & insecure in their own back garden.

attributes.action: Jail for 30 days if you leave pets/children unnattended in cars on a hot day.
attributes.background: The amount of people leaving their pets in hot cars on a summers day is insane. People know the dangers but dont seem to care. I propose a minimum jail term of 30 days for people who commit this act against animals or children.
attributes.additional_details: evidence is everywhere

attributes.action: DVLA website services to be available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
attributes.background: The DVLA website is only open Monday to Saturday 8am and 6pm to deal with certain issues (for example, telling them when you have bought or sold a vehicle). This is ridiculous. A website should be open 24 hours, seven days a week. There is no reason for it not to be.
attributes.additional_details: This affects us all by making it more difficult for us by forcing us to deal with matters during these specific times and not in evenings/outside office hours. The Government is here to serve us, the people, not the other way round. This is an example of self serving bureaucracy gone wrong. It's also wasteful, as it encourages people to deal with the matter by post instead of using the website. This wastes paper (and therefore kills trees) and creates unnecessary administration costs.

attributes.action: Change burden of proof of dangerous dog to be responsibility of the accuser.
attributes.background: Many innocent dogs have been seized from their owners and euthanised, and it is the responsibility of the respective owners to prove that their dog is not a banned type. This is a perversion of the burden of proof and needs to be changed so that the authorities must prove that the dog is banned.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, a dog is determined to be dangerous by the authorities based on the dog's appearance, rather than by hard evidence or by what the dog has done. It is currently the responsibility of the owner of the dog to prove the claim that the dog is dangerous to be false. If the owner cannot prove this negative, the dog is then euthanised. 

"Whether your dog is a banned type depends on what it looks like, rather than its breed or name." Source: https://www.gov.uk/control-dog-public/banned-dogs

attributes.action: Stop UK Airports and Private companies making money from Airport forecourts.
attributes.background:
Airports in the UK have gradually introduced charging for dropping off and in some cases are using private companies and the Police to enforce only picking people up from inside the terminals rather than on the forecourts.
I feel this is not a security issue but rather a money making exercise!
attributes.additional_details:
Heathrow - Dropoff only free and Police (HAL Bylaws) enforcement for pickup in terminal.
London City - Dropoff free and new enforcement of Pickup in Shortstay £5.50!
Stansted - Forecourt dropoff or pickup now £3.00 for 10 mins!
Luton Airport - Dropoff area £2.50 for 10 minutes and Expensive Shortstay for pickups.

People in the Hackney Carriage, Taxi & Private Hire industry especially are having a hard enough time making a living at present without these indiscriminate rules.

attributes.action: Ban people working when temperature goes over 30C or 27C in a physical job
attributes.background:
Bring in a law were employers have to send home employees when temperature goes over 30C or 27C when working in a physical job

There is no guideline on being sent home if the work place gets too hot, working in a too hot enviroment can cause dehydration and risk of fainting

attributes.action: Close schools when temperature reaches 30 Degrees Celsius.
attributes.background:
Should schools be closed in a heat wave?
Students are forced to remain at school in uncomfortable weather conditions, following their strict school uniform or business wear in sixth forms. These high, uncomfortable weather conditions enable individuals to feeling distracted and lose concentration.
attributes.additional_details:
Teachers also claim that  young individuals can become lethargic and less likely to concentrate. however, within hot weather conditions, students and teachers are also likely to faint.

Schools are due to break up for the summer holidays within the next week, but in the meantime many children are coping with “hot and stuffy” classrooms. And, should be shut within atrocious weather conditions. In addition, some schools do not have air conditioning systems or do not use them as they are costly.

attributes.action: Make the title nutritionist protected
attributes.background: there are many people out there that call them selfs a Nutritionist  however quite a few of them do not hold any degree that gives them the right to be called one let alone to work as one, some people tend to do a few day course which  this will allow them to give nutrition advice out to people
attributes.additional_details:
due to these few days  courses  which people do this causes a knock on effect on our jobs as a nutritionist also this puts people health at risk due to the advice that gets given is incorrect on a few accounts. 

make our title protected like the dietetics is protected

attributes.action: Ban barbeque's within built up and residential areas in the UK
attributes.background: I find it extremely offensive to have to breath in smoke of any kind bellowing from a neighbors garden.The smell gets into my laundry that I hang outside and also my upholstery/bedding. It stinks my entire home out which also means theres no chance that I can enjoy an evening in my own garden.
attributes.additional_details: I haven't eaten meat for 27 years so I am fully evolved and for that reason barbeque's are extremely offensive to someone like myself and why should I have to put of with this smell in my home?Even if I wasn't a Vegan I would still find smoke bellowing through my home unacceptable.Please help me to ban barbecues within built up and residential areas in the UK

attributes.action: Make prejudicial, unfactual and opinion/vote swaying news reporting criminal.
attributes.background: UK media is now completely corrupted & has become a weapon of mass destruction in itself. We urgently need revised legislation, to ensure that it is no longer used as a tool to sway public opinion in false or self destructive directions. We need this now for the good of the UK & more so for mankind.
attributes.additional_details: VOTE LEAVE TODAY was the front cover of the Daily Express, on the day of the EU referendum. A newspaper should report news for the benefit of the people. Not sway opinion for its own secret agendas. The first 24 hours after the killings in Nice, BBC and all news outlets kept stating Mohamed Bouhlel had no known terrorist links. Yet in the same breath, kept claiming it to be a war act & terrorist attack. If no links, this reporting is biased & inflammatory. Set laws now to stop the propaganda.

attributes.action: Stop the rise of youth crime- introduce harsher punishments as a deterrent.
attributes.background: As young people we think youth crime is a problem and more needs to be done about it. We think there should be harsher punishments, especially for repeated offenders as it is unfair all young people and teenagers are labeled 'thugs'.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Daily Mail, under 18s commit a quarter of all crimes.

Statistics on www.gov.uk show that in 2013/14 there were 90,769 offences which resulted in a disposal, and the most common offence was violence against the person.

attributes.action: Allow non resident UK Citizens to also vote on whether the UK Leaves the EU
attributes.background: British people living abroad were NOT allowed a vote and are hugely impacted by the outcome. We form a constituency of people who live a special way of life in the EU - the life that experiences free movement of labour and we well understand free trade benefits. An important voice could not vote.
attributes.additional_details:
I am British, I live in Germany. I have a UK pension, I am likely expected to pay inheritance tax upon death and who knows where I might retire. This decision affects people like me too and we need to have a vote on this matter.
The UK parliament should debate if we are now allowed also a vote which should be integrated retrospectively with the referendum already held, and see how this impacts the referendum result.

attributes.action: Amend Fixed-Term Parliaments Act to require a General Election if the PM resigns
attributes.background: When voting during a General Election, it is likely voters base their decision not only on who they want to represent them locally, but also who they would like to represent the country on the global stage. If the PM resigns, the public should get to vote again based on the new leadership.
attributes.additional_details:
Why the resignation comes about is irrelevant - this is NOT to do with the current Brexit issue.

This is NOT a request for a GE based purely on the outcome of the referendum (and so is vastly different to petition 133548), but for a change in the law to cover scenarios whereby the PM chooses to resign during a fixed term parliament. 

The public should get to choose the new Prime Minister, knowing who it is that's going to lead the country for the next 5 years, not just the members of a party.

attributes.action: Ban the funding of political parties by any individual, company or organisation.
attributes.background:
Instead, all parties which command a minimum membership, should receive an identical sum from the state for all promotional activities. All eligible parties should be funded by the taxpayer. 

Accepting funding in any form from a third party would become a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
This would ensure that strong leaders with vision become the loudest voices, rather than those with financial backing from vested interests.

The Conservatives would cease to be hijacked by the interest of big business and lobby groups and Labour would cease to be highjacked by the Unions. 

There would be a genuinely level playing field which would encourage radical, positive change.

Only then can we create a political system that is truly representative - and one that we can all be proud of.

attributes.action: Make law all party members are allowed to vote in a party leadership election .
attributes.background: This law will make leadership races more democratic and stamp out gerrymandering.

attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: RSPCA vehicles to have some type of emergency lighting
attributes.background: RSPCA vehicles need to have some type of emergency lighting because pets mean the world to someone like everyone else, and animals need help quickly too and they can't get to places during rush hour traffic so its life or death for an animal

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Change the driving license rules for up to 7.5 tonne vehicles.
attributes.background: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1996 needs to be adapted to include C1 and C1E category after provisional on a background check-points basis so that all the people who were born from 1979 onwards get the same driving possibilities as those who passed their driving test before 1996.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today, anyone who has passed their driving test prior to 1996 can drive any vehicle up to 7.5 tonnes. In 1998 this meant that a few thousand 18 and 19 year-olds were left out of the equation but by 2016, not only everybody from 18 to 37 (roughly 16.8 million people) can't drive a large van or small lorry but your 75 year-old granny can. This leaves many responsible grown-ups finding it very difficult when needing to drive, hire or purchase any vehicle between 3.5 and 7.5 tonnes.

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: Pull our troops out of any provocative acts towards Russia.
attributes.background: To anyone with a little knowledge it is easy to see that the US and UK governmentso are trying to provoke Russia with extremely dangerous and hostile acts, including the strategic placement of missile systems.  We the people DO NOT want a war with Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has sent troops to the Russian border.

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: Stop bonfires, during the hours of daylight, in residential areas.
attributes.background: I live in an area with large gardens but neighbours frequently have bonfires during daylight hours. Smoke never blows into their garden! Gardens should be enjoyed and relaxing but this is impossible with smoke making you choke. If they waited until after dark, then no-one would be affected by it.

attributes.action: General elections after the UK referendum and after presentation of BREXIT plan
attributes.background: The referendum resultet in a small minority of just over 50% of voters to leave the EU. The political leadership is broken down, negativ economical effects have emerged already. The UK situation is historically unique and has long term effects for future generations. General elections are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: The economic, political and social future of the UK is uncertain for years. The referendum was not a vote for a Brexiteer government.  Brexiteers need to come up with a short, medium and long term plan and well thought through vision, present this to parliament and the population. The same applies for other parties. Immediately afterwards, the populations needs to have the right to choose which party they trust most with this challenging tasks ahead through their vote in general elections .

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Reform this country before deciding on enacting Article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Mass migration was seen as many to be a root cause for dissent with the EU, yet some UK firms advertise exclusively in Eastern European countries to take advantage of cheap labour. Change our laws to prevent this. Any building firm that hires migrant workers to employ the same number of apprentices
attributes.additional_details: Also, boost money into the NHS by properly claiming with the E111 system or enforcing health insurance for non-EU visitors.  In the Oct 2013 yougov report, this could save £500million annually. All UK residents must pay taxes for 12months before being eligible for benefits. This will also empower our youth to get off benefits as most migrants are much less likely to claim benefits. If UK firms must pay UK and non-UK people the same salary, there is much less incentive for mass migration

attributes.action: Vote registration system to validate UK citizenship prior to issuing ballot card
attributes.background: Many people unelligable to vote because they are not UK citizens are illegally registering to vote in UK ballots because there are insufficient background checks on nationality. In particular this was highlighted in the EU referendum, where non-UK citizens were voting to remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Background checks on citizenship must be applied prior to registration acceptance to prevent electoral fraud. 

Where people do commit fraud in elections there needs to be a mechanism for criminal prosecution, rigorously followed through by the police and courts.

attributes.action: Ask public about immigration before negotiating new EU deals
attributes.background: On June 23rd the UK voted to leave the EU. A number of public figures have suggested which factors swayed voters, but the question asked makes it impossible to know public opinion on specific issues. We believe the government cannot claim a mandate to negotiate a new deal without polling.
attributes.additional_details: Some have claimed that immigration was a key factor in the result, but it is impossible to say for certain that a majority of those who voted leave did so to prevent free movement of people. The government should take steps to more effectively gauge public opinion on the nature of Britain’s exit from the EU, so that it can act on facts, not speculation. The issues of environmental legislation, the EU arrest warrant, and the court of human rights should also be included in the poll.

attributes.action: Raise the salary for childcare workers in the early years sector
attributes.background: Childcare workers in the early years have one of the most important jobs in the sector as a whole. They are responsible for the early education, health and wellbeing of children under 5. A rewarding job is there ever was one however this is not reflected in their salaries.
attributes.additional_details: The average full time childcare worker in the early years sector makes less than £1050 per month after deductions. This simply is not reflective of the love, hard work, sacrifice and determination to give the future the best possible start in life. As a childcare worker there is no greater joy than helping a child succeed at being a child and being happy, healthy and confident. But job satisfaction can only take you so far when a roof over your head is needed.

attributes.action: Allow the alternative vote in the next General Election
attributes.background: With the current state of the country and the government in turmoil a General Election looks likely. We demand it incorporates the alternative vote system in order to encourage a fairer outcome for all political parties and allow voters to adequately portray their political views.

attributes.action: Stop Expatriates Having A Vote On British Issues Such As Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Just over 4.5 million Britons live abroad with approximately 1.3 million of them in Europe. Allowing them to vote on British issues severely alters the results of elections and referendums.
If Britain isn't good enough for them to live or pay Tax in then why should they have a say in how it is run?
attributes.additional_details:
We saw during the EU referendum over a million Spanish expats (selfishly) tried to vote 'stay' in Europe purely because they wanted to keep their NHS benefits abroad! Not for the good of the country.

Sign if you believe British Expats who do not live or pay Tax in the Britain should NOT be able to vote in Britain!

attributes.action: Seize this opportunity to reform the EU by offering an alternative system.
attributes.background: Across Europe much dissatisfaction is being heard, with membership referenda being called for in many other countries. We have the world's best diplomats. This is an opportunity for us to seize the initiative in constructing a Europe Mk II that  recognises sovereignty but encourages free trade.

attributes.action: Bring back milk for primary school children
attributes.background: When I was younger we always had a small milk bottle with a straw. I think it's really important for children to get calcium and in this busy day and age ensures that all children get some milk.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for over 25s to £10.00 hour.
attributes.background: Minimum wage for over 25s is set to increase in April next year. This is is not good/quick enough. The minimum wage for over 25 currently stands at £7.20ph.
attributes.additional_details: Minimum wage should increase for over 25s from £7.20 to £10.00, £7.20 is not a liveable wage at all, it's time for a new minimum wage to take place straight away.

attributes.action: Allow Norwich South to have a referendum to become independent from the UK
attributes.background: Norwich South voted to remain in the EU, the only remain constitiency in Norfolk. We shouldn't have to be taken out of the EU against our own will. If we are to remain in the UK then the Golden Triangle shall revolt!
attributes.additional_details: Norwich South was the only place in Norfolk to vote to remain in the EU, one of five in East Anglia.

attributes.action: As law all convicted racists must integrate with whom they discriminate against
attributes.background: Instead of a slap on the wrist show them the people they are discriminating against, in a community service like format make them for example: go to mosque or church and go to community gatherings for an alotted ammount of hours

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.
